subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] FW: Test of Kingsley font with Keyman program using J. F. Colson's mapping
msgSnippet: Thanks for the reply.  The interesting thing is the correct key strokes are still embedded in the message.  If one simply copies the message, it can then be
messageBody:
Thanks for the reply.  The interesting thing is the correct key strokes are still embedded in the message.  If one simply copies the message, it can then be pasted into a word processor (assuming one has the proper font, which was Kingsley in this case) and it will appear in QS.  This is not an elegant solution, but it works.  I tried it with the copy of my e-mail, and it is perfect. (see note below)  So if someone wants to send messages in QS, the rest of the group could read it and still use it for practice reading if they don’t mind copying it into their word processor.

 

Anyone interested?

 

 

Paige

 

Note:  Well, not perfect, as after I wrote it, I was still messing around with the keyman keyboard mapping and managed, inadvertently, to put in a mistake or two.  I also left the namer dot off Mr. Colson’s name.

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com [mailto:Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of yahoo.5.haelo@...
Sent: Saturday, August 13, 2005 7:12 PM
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] FW: Test of Kingsley font with Keyman program using J. F. Colson's mapping

 

It does not work via email, it seems, and this is one that 
understands HTML email (unfortunately).

-Av
